data.title: TALES OF TERROR (1962): The fourth in Roger Corman’s series of Edgar Allan Poe adaptations, Tales of Terror wouldn’t be released in Mexico...
data.meta_description: 17 likes, 1 comments - mexicanmovieposters on August 2, 2021: "TALES OF TERROR (1962): The fourth in Roger Corman’s series of Edgar Allan Poe adaptations, Tales of Terror wouldn’t be released in Mexico for another two years, where it was given the new title “Destinos Fatales.” The original art was also completely discarded, replaced by a full color collage of the film’s stars, using different images than those found on any other posters around the world. When re-released in Mexico several years later, no longer through MGM, the new distributor reverted to the original title and art, with the one unique creative idea being a warped and tinted still. From design all the way to paper quality, it’s a pretty dramatic drop-off between the two versions. Starring Vincent Price (The Last Man on Earth; Edward Scissorhands), Peter Lorre (M; The Maltese Falcon), Basil Rathbone (The Hound of the Baskervilles; Voyage to the Prehistoric Planet), Debra Paget (The Ten Commandments; Love Me Tender) and Joyce Jameson (Death Race 2000; The Outlaw Josey Wales). Cinematography by Floyd Crosby (High Noon; X: The Man with X-Ray Eyes), written by Richard Matheson (The Legend of Hell House; Duel). Produced and directed by Roger Corman (The House of Usher; Frankenstein Unbound)".
